theme.Question: Who is the youngest player to win a Grand Slam in tennis?
theme.Explanation: Martina Hingis won the Australian Open in 1997 at the age of 16, becoming the youngest Grand Slam singles winner.

theme.Question: Which player holds the record for the longest winning streak in tennis?
theme.Explanation: Martina Navratilova held a 74-match winning streak in 1984, dominating the women's tennis circuit remarkably.

theme.Question: In which year did Wimbledon implement a tie-break system for the final set?
theme.Explanation: Wimbledon decided to introduce a final set tie-break rule at 12-12 in 2019 to avoid lengthy matches and ensure a thrilling conclusion.

theme.Question: Who is the first male player to win a Career Golden Slam in tennis?
theme.Explanation: Andre Agassi completed the Career Golden Slam by winning all four Grand Slam tournaments and the Olympic gold medal in men's singles.

theme.Question: Which tennis player has won the most Grand Slam singles titles?
theme.Explanation: Margaret Court holds the record for the most Grand Slam singles titles with 24, achieved between 1960 and 1973.

theme.Question: How many times has Rafael Nadal won the French Open?
theme.Explanation: Rafael Nadal has an outstanding record, winning the French Open 13 times, establishing himself as the 'King of Clay' in tennis history.

theme.Question: Who is the only player to have achieved a Calendar-year Grand Slam twice in tennis?
theme.Explanation: Rod Laver is the only player in history to have won the Calendar-year Grand Slam twice, in 1962 and 1969.

theme.Question: How many times has the Davis Cup been won by the United States?
theme.Explanation: The United States holds a dominant record of 32 Davis Cup victories, showcasing their historic tennis prowess.

theme.Question: What type of court surface is used at the Miami Open?
theme.Explanation: The Miami Open is played on a hard court surface, providing a fast and challenging playing environment for the players.

theme.Question: Who holds the record for most consecutive weeks as ATP World No. 1?
theme.Explanation: Roger Federer holds the record for the most consecutive weeks as ATP World No. 1, with 237 weeks at the top of the rankings.

theme.Question: Which player has won the most Olympic gold medals in tennis?
theme.Explanation: Serena Williams holds the record for the most Olympic gold medals in tennis, with four gold medals across singles and doubles events.

theme.Question: Who was the first African American to win a Grand Slam tournament?
theme.Explanation: Althea Gibson became the first African American to win a Grand Slam tournament when she won the French Championships in 1956.

theme.Question: In which year did the Australian Open move to the Melbourne Park venue?
theme.Explanation: The Australian Open moved to the Melbourne Park venue in 1988, providing modern facilities and a larger capacity for tennis fans.

theme.Question: Who was the youngest player to win a title at the US Open?
theme.Explanation: Tracy Austin became the youngest player to win the US Open singles title, achieving this feat at the age of 16 in 1979.

theme.Question: Which player holds the record for the most singles titles at Wimbledon?
theme.Explanation: Martina Navratilova won a record 9 singles titles at Wimbledon, showcasing her dominance on the grass court.

theme.Question: What is the longest match in tennis history in terms of time?
theme.Explanation: The match between John Isner and Nicolas Mahut at Wimbledon 2010 is the longest tennis match in history, lasting 11 hours and 5 minutes.

theme.Question: How many times has the French Open been won by Bjorn Borg?
theme.Explanation: Bjorn Borg won the French Open 6 times, showcasing his exceptional dominance on the clay courts in Paris.

theme.Question: Who was the first British woman to win a Grand Slam singles title since 1977?
theme.Explanation: Virginia Wade won the Wimbledon singles title in 1977, breaking the 20-year British drought in Grand Slam singles victories.

theme.Question: Which tennis player is known for his 'tweener' shots?
theme.Explanation: Roger Federer is renowned for his 'tweener' shots, displaying exceptional skills and creativity on the tennis court.

theme.Question: Who is the youngest player to win a Grand Slam in the Open Era?
theme.Explanation: Tracy Austin holds the record as the youngest Grand Slam winner in the Open Era, securing the US Open title at the age of 16 in 1979.
